flawed_nl_solution:
Jose has half as many bottles of domestic wine as imported wine, or 2400/2=<<2400/2=1200>>1200 bottles of domestic wine.
In total, he has 2400+1200=<<2400+1200=3600>>3600 bottles of wine.
If the guests drink one-third of all his wine, then they will have consumed 3600/3=<<3600/3=1020>>1020 bottles of wine.
Thus, after the party, Jose's private cellar will have 3600-1020=<<3600-1020=2580>>2580 remaining bottles of wine.

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 1200.0, not 1020.0. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
